title: add test logging, disable runallproves on jenkins (testing)
fixes 1504
description:
(Quick)fix for #1504. 

**KeY master (after origin label update) was not able to load any proof/problem on Windows.**

> Direct merge because of *small impact* of the change and the importance of the Windows platform.

The problem is that ":" is not valid in Windows paths (or at least in
windows paths of NIO). OriginTermLabel.java uses `Paths.get` to parse
the given filename and try to get the filename. After fix, it uses the
more liberal File API.

The main problem is that the paths encoded in the `PositionedString`
(used in the AST) are not accurate: They are neither a valid or a valid URL:

```
 /C:/Users/weigl/IdeaProjects/key/key/key.ui/URL:jar:file:/C:/Users/weigl/IdeaProjects/key/key/key.core/build/libs/key.core-2.7.0-aad3f287d1.jar!/de/uka/ilkd/key/java/JavaRedux/java/lang/NullPointerException.java
```

The first part `/C:/Users/weigl/IdeaProjects/key/key/key.ui/URL:` is not
a valid protocol. Then the original Java URL comes up:
`jar:file:...`

Someone with more *deep KeY* experience should investigate this.
It seemes to be introduced in `SLEEnvInput`. 

/cc @lanzinger

title: Fix License Headers
description:
1. This MR enables https://github.com/hierynomus/license-gradle-plugin for our project. 
2. Adds a new `gradle/header`:
```
This file is part of KeY - https://key-project.org
The KeY system is protected by the GNU General Public License Version 2

Copyright (C) 2001-2011 Universitaet Karlsruhe (TH), Germany
                        Universitaet Koblenz-Landau, Germany
                        Chalmers University of Technology, Sweden
Copyright (C) 2011-2019 Karlsruhe Institute of Technology, Germany
                        Technical University Darmstadt, Germany
                        Chalmers University of Technology, Sweden
```

3. Does not include any updates to files. Waiting for release

For the future! Use:

* `gradle licenseMain`  to check the license of the files
* `gradle licenseFormatMain` to update the license header

Recommended: We could remove `/FileHeaderModifier` project.

title: Try to decrease written test output
description:
We recognise that our written output into `*/build/test-results/*/TEST-*.xml` is several gigabytes. 
Examining the problem, we encountered the line 

> The settings in /home/kaprcs/.key/proof-settings.props are *not* read. 

This MR disables the print-out to check a decreasing storage consumption.

## How to check it.

Goto workspaces for the run on Jenkins.

For example: http://hudson.se.informatik.tu-darmstadt.de/job/KeY_gitlab_merge_request/ws/key/key.core/build/test-results/

And investigate whether: 

> TEST-de.uka.ilkd.key.proof.proverules.ProveRulesTest.xml
> TEST-de.uka.ilkd.key.rule.merge.MergeRuleTests.xml 
> TEST-de.uka.ilkd.key.util.TestProofStarter.xml       

are over 100 MB large.

title: repaired parser test for char literals
description:
Our JML parser does not support Unicode escapes in String and char literals,
Unicode escapes are processed and replaced during the first run of the Java parser (i.e. recoder).

Therefore, the parser could not parse the Unicode char **escapes** given in the tests previously,
I changed it in a way that the JML parser is tested with actual Unicode **chars** instead of **escapes**.

title: Whitelisting Testcases
description:
**requires !179 **

*Old:* Test are only executed if they participate in a specified Test Suite.

*New:* Every test is executed! 
   - To run *fast* tests use `gradle testFast`
   - To run all (non-interactive) tests use `gradle test`
   - run all proves and prove rule tests are untouched

**This merge request also split up the gradle file into files for each sub-project.**

*Hint:* Use `@Ignore` to deactivate your test cases; only in combination with a good and meaningful justification.

*Hint:* You can create new junit test categories. See `build.gradle` and `key.util/../testcategories/Slow.java`.
     
*Hint:* Mark slow running test cases (ca. >10 secs.) to let out on gitlab ci.

**Categories:**

* Interactive    -- never consider for unit tests, use for sketches or manual test classes.
* Slow           -- slow cases cases run on Jenkins, but not on Gitlab CI
  * Performance  -- performance regression tests, only run on demand or on master

title: Proof Exploration
description:
Proof Exploration brings several (free) editing operations for the manipulation of sequents. 
This enables "What-If"-Analyses in proof situation. 


Proof Exploration are programmed as a KeY-GUI extension but extensions in `key.ui` are necessary to improve the flexibility:
* Proof nodes in the proof tree are rendered accordingly to a strategy (a list of `Stylers`) rather than a fixed algorithm.
  Therefore, extensions can register new stylers to customize the look of the proof nodes.
* `Proof`, `KeYMediator` now caries a `Lookup` object to manage information in the lifecycle of a proof or the GUI application.

End user documentation will be created under https://key-project.org/docs/user/Exploration/

milestone.title: v2.10.0
milestone.description:
The next major version after 2.8.0. 

We decided the following in the KaKeY meetings:
* feature freeze: November 15th
* subsequently: testing by Hiwis
* first week of December: testing and bug fixing event with staff
* release date: shortly prior to christmas, such that it is available for teaching in formal methods course

description: Switches to automode when applying successful proofs provided by an SMT solver, speeding the process up by several orders of magnitude.

title: Gui Extensions and Common UI
description:
This merge request changes and brings new GUI Extensions and also a Common UI for Settings.

Gui Extension are now loaded differently.

* Every gui extension should be marked with `KeyGuiExtension` is only loaded once.
* Additional meta data can plugged to an extension by adding  `@KeyGuiExtension.Info`.
  - Currently: `name`, `description`, `disabled`, `optional`, `priority`.
  - Annotation because of accessible via the class w/o instantiation.
* Extension Points are now in `KeyGuiExtension`
  - `KeyGuiExtension.MainMenu`
  - `KeyGuiExtension.ContextMenu`
  - `KeyGuiExtension.LeftPanel`
  - `KeyGuiExtension.Toolbar`
  - `KeyGuiExtension.StatusLine`
  - `KeyGuiExtension.Settings` 
  - `KeyGuiExtension.KeyboardShortcuts`

* A common settings dialog should replace all existing setting dialogs.
  - A component can register a `SettingsProvider` to the `SettingsManager.getInstance()` 
    to participate in the default instance.
  - A `SettingsProvider` offers mainly a description, a panel, and a handler to save the settings. 
  - A `SettingsProvider` can have children (`SettingsProvider`).  
  - An extension can announce a `SettingsProvider` by declaring to be `KeyGuiExtension.Settings`.
  - Existing settings were adopted.
* `KeYIconManagement` and `KeYIcon` introduces a way of icon management and configuration via `UIManager`.  
* Changes to settings: It is now possible to hook into the proof-independent/-dependent settings by calling 
  `addSettings(Settings)`. 
* Brings `Lookup` a successor for a flexible mediator replacement based on a service architecture, incl. Dependency Injection
* Refactoring: Parts of `MiscTools` are split up into `Strings`, `KeyCollections` and `Files` in `key.util`.
* *Update:* `KeyStrokeManager` reworked. 
   It is now possible to define `KeyStroke`s in a properties file.
* *Update:* `ColorSettings`manages colors in a central place. Colors are editable by the GUI. 
* *Update:* Added docking framework from !195

title: Loop contract improvements
description:
Improves the implementation of loop contracts.


* Loop contracts previously required a block around the loop. This is no longer necessary, i.e., loop contracts can be added directly to the loop.
 
* Loop contracts can now be added to enhanced for-loops (for-each loops).

* The names of most classes that have to do with block & loop contracts have been changed to be more clear.

title: Gradle Build with a new folder layout
description:
[Gradle](https://gradle.org/) should be the build tool of the KeY system!

After discussion with @mulbrich I propose gradle with the default layout of maven/gradle project (cf. !41)

# Features 

* [x] compile Java sources
* [x] compiles Java test sources
* [x] build Jar files
* [x] run KeY with `gradle run`
* [x] run KeY Tests (Suites)
* [x] Building the `examples.zip`
* [x] building something like the key deployment folder
* [x] Checkstyle, PMD, FindBugs

## Improvements

# Postpone

* [ ] [Jar sigining](https://docs.gradle.org/current/userguide/signing_plugin.html)
* [ ] [Publication](https://docs.gradle.org/current/userguide/artifact_management.html)

# Impact

... a lot.

In this requests is `scripts/newlayout.sh`, which moves and renames the files; changes to gradle. 
Current I need 115 lines of Gradle. 

## Reorganize project structure 

I would like to connect the introduction of gradle with a file restructuring towards a maven (gradle) layout. 
This would mean:

* Subprojects *X* und *X*.test are merged together into *X*.
* The source folder becomes `src/{main,test}/{java,antlr,javacc,resources}`
* The manifest files are hardly needed, and would be removed.
* Everything should be reachable by Java or within a Jar file would be in `src/*/resources`.

Advantages: (*) default used project layout (*) easier configuration with gradle.

description: This fixes three unsound taclets in taclet base for wellFormed (wrongly set parentheses).

title: SMT preparation macro
description: Adds a new macro that combines auto pilot preparation with heap simplification. In common use cases, this does everything needed to make the SMT translation work as expected. Also useful for developing the new SMT translation because it saves a lot of repetitive right-clicking.

title: Slightly less confusing presentation of SMT solver results
description:
If an SMT solver is applied and finds a counterexample, the interface now displays the result "Possible counter example." This is less confusing than the old version "Counter example!", because in reality, counterexamples are often spurious, which is only obvious to KeY experts.
In addition, a warning is displayed if one of the goals contains KeY-specific parts that are not handled by the SMT translation, like updates, queries, or modalities. This is to further reduce confusion for non-expert KeY users.

title: Fixes and new features for proof scripts
Proof Script Fixes
description:
Fixes some issues with proof scripts:

- Taclets with "\newLabel, \new" etc. could not be applied since we first have to try an instantiation to fill in those fresh symbols and only then check whether the *remaining* SVs are instantiated
- Varargs did not work since the retention policy was forgotten to add there
- Now, also finds locally added taclets like "insert_hidden_*" after hide rule apps
- Can now "set steps=XXX" to set maximum number of proof steps.

title: Bugfixing handling of program variables of type "any" and parsing
infinite union as a binder
description:
This merge request promotes `infinite_union` into a binder:

Two changes are implemented into the syntax of **JML***:

1. `(\infinite_union <mod>? (<type> <var>)*; <storerefexpr>)` is now a valid expression.
2. Parsing of `\infinite_union(...)` results into a deprecation warning:

```
!!! Deprecation Warnung: You used \infinite_union in the functional syntax.
This is deprecated and won't be valid after adopting OpenJML.
Please use \infinite_union as a binder: (\infinite_union var type; expr).
```

## Background

This merge request homogenized the syntax of JML. `infinite_union` binds a set of variable, but was not compliant to the grammar of binders like `\forall` or `\bsum`.

This merge request is in preparation for a possible OpenJML migration.

title: Fix for #1481
description: Fixed now: I just forgot to add the relevant `*` to the current token.

title: Fix loop in strategy
description: Assigned the rules a more fitting less low lost ruleset, this avoids an endless loop in cases where the assumes sequent matches a formula of the shape "anon(h,l,h2) = h"

title: Postponed testing for duplicate rule application of apply_equations rules to approval phase
description: Postponing saves in average several computations of this expensive feature as rules might no longer applicable at the approval stage (which can be tested for much faster)

title: Improve hashing of terms with metavariables
description: Metavariables are only used in quantifier instantiation. They are named identical but only considered to be equal if they are the same object. Removed name based hashing.

title: Origin labels
description:
Adds term labels that contain a term's origin in the JML specification.
This allows the user to see where a term and its sub-terms come from by left-clicking on the term and then on "Show Origin".
A term's origin is a triple consisting of a spec type ("requires"/"ensures"/etc.), a file name, and a line number.
